intro: Adenopodia patens, commonly known as the spreading adenopodia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or scrub habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it may be challenging to grow outside its native range.
